train: Karrinja nyulu kirriya barrawunu.
The woman is standing in the house.
Jungku nyulu burrurri kundana.
The man is sitting under a tree.
Jungku bula nawunu rajini.
They are here in the camp.
Dabarraba nyulu waliji, nangkani burrurrii.
This man is cooking meat.
Balikajba nyulu, walijiyanyi, nana kirriya.
She is hungry for meat, that woman.
Nayi burrurri, lalujbu nyulu.
This man, he gets up.
Kanungku barri nyulu jilaba kirriyawurru.
He then goes up to the woman.
Wijbi barri nyulu kirriya walijiyanyi jangkaranyiyanyi, karrinjawurru.
Then he gives some cooked meat to the woman who’s standing.
Nanangkani kirriyaa, nanganja barri nyulu manii nana waliji burrurrinanja.
That woman, she then takes that meat with her hand from the man.
Jarrba barri nyulu, balikajini, nanangkani kirriyaa, nana waliji, karrinjana nanawunu barrawunu.
Then that woman hungrily eats that meat, standing there in the house.
Jawikajba barri nyulu burrurri: Ninji, wanyi ninji jarrba?
She then asks the man. What are you eating?
Budangku ngawu jarrba jalanya.
I’m not eating now.
Jilakanyi ngawu kakuwanyi nanganjaanyi. Karubu‐yanyba ngawu.
I’ll go and catch some fish. I’m going fishing.
Wunjuku ninji jilaba?
Where are you going?
Kularra ngawu jilaba, nanangkurru manangkawurru.
I’m going south, to that river.
Ngabungabu, malijibi nyulu kirriyaa, banjana nyulu jilaba.
Late afternoon, the woman followed him, she went after.
Najba barri nyulu, burrurri, jungkuwurru, karubu‐yanykurru.
Then she saw the man sitting fishing.
Manangkana nyulu jungku, nana burrurri.
That man was sitting by the river.
Najba nyulu kirriya, kanungkuwurru.
He saw the woman approaching.
Kawa! Jilanji nangkurru.
Come! Walk over here!
Jawikajba nyulu burrurri kanungkunu.
She asked the man as she approached.
Kaku ninji nanganja?
Have you caught any fish?
Budangku ngawu kakuwanyi.
I’ve got no fish.
Budangku nayi kakuwanyi.
There’s no fish here.
Ngamuyu‐kiya ninji nanganja kaku nawunu. Kaja.
I thought you would have caught fish here. Lots.
Yanyba nyulu nangangi.
He said to her:
Najba ngawu kaku nawunu wanamini, bilikijawurru, bungkuna.
I saw fish swimming here in the water yesterday.
Budangku yalu balikajba walijiyanyi jalanya.
They are not hungry for meat right now.
Ngadijbi yaluwangka bulinjana.
They are hiding in the water-grass.
Rajiwurru barri bula kannga, budangku kakuwanyi.
They both returned home, without any fish.
Balikajini bula kannga rajiwurru, kirriya, burrurri.
They both return home hungry – the woman and the man.
test: (There’s no trees here./Here are no trees./No trees are here)
(They [both] then (asked/questioned) this man./They are [both] now (questioning/asking) this man.)
The man and the woman are sitting here.
Dabarraba nyulu nana waliji (nangkani burrurrii/burrurrii nangkani) (kundana karrinjana/karrinjana kundana).
This man cooks that meat standing near a tree.
